awd_titl_txt: Individual Video Assisted Instruction in Signal Processing  for Mechanical Engineering Students
awd_abstract_narration: The purpose of this project is to prepare undergraduate mechanical              engineering students in the use of contemporary signal processing               techniques as part of their instrumentation laboratory course                   experience.  The students will use a digital storage oscilloscope, a            menu-driven X-Y plotter, and a sweep/function generator in                      conjunction with existing laboratory equipment to prototype and                 test a variety of signal conditioning and signal processing                     circuits and systems.  Groups of three students each will perform               their investigations in a video-assisted individualized                         instruction, multi-stationed undergraduate laboratory.  The new                 equipment along with existing laboratory equipment and the                      innovative video teaching system will offer individualized, hands- on           experience for the students in the use and understanding of                     modern signal processing.  This experience is most pertinent for                engineers using control instrumentation found in industrial                     integrated manufacturing systems.
org_div_long_name: Office of Emerging Frontiers in Research and Innovation (EFRI)
